## Question
Write a function that will take a vector as input and return the vector with NAs changed to a null string (““) if the vector is a character vector or to 0 if it is a numeric vector. Test your function on extreme examples.

## Answer
We first write our function:
```{r}
replace_na <- function(vec) {
  result <- vec
  if (is.character(vec)) {
    result <- replace(vec, is.na(vec), "")
  }
  else if (is.numeric(vec)) {
    result <- replace(vec, is.na(vec), 0)
  }
  return(result)
}
```

Testing on some extreme cases:
```{r}
replace_na(c(NA, NA, NA))
replace_na(c(NA, "", NA))
replace_na(c(NA, 4))
replace_na(as.factor(c("Hello", "World", NA)))
replace_na(c("Hello", "World"))
replace_na(c(2, 7.3))
replace_na(c(2, 7.3, NA))
```
